attributes.action: Place Mindfulness in to the UK school Curriculum
attributes.background: As a family fitness business we see the importance in health and well-being and we see a huge gap in a healthy mentality amongst children and adults too. We believe that by placing an extra subject in to the uk school curriculum this would benefit the future generations massively.
attributes.additional_details: Good health comes from a healthy fitness level, healthy diet and a healthy mindset. A lot of thought and action has gone in to improving school children’s outlook on sport and fitness, as well as nutrition but the mentality of this young generation is still pretty untouched.

attributes.action: Increase the defence budget to strengthen and build up the UK's Armed Forces.
attributes.background: The UK needs to strengthen and build up it's Armed Forces in order to be able to counter any threat to the Nation and to better its capabilities as a part of NATO.

attributes.action: Ban balloons for marketing/business use  immediately.
attributes.background: Balloons used for marketing  often have ribbon tied to them.This is a fatal combination for wildlife.The balloon chokes and the string wraps around the wildlife, killing or maiming.There are better alternatives, like plastic free bunting.Children would not want the balloon if they knew it could kill
attributes.additional_details:
https://balloonsblow.org
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/balloon-releases-are-killing-animals/
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/litter
http://m.worldanimalfoundation.org/articles/article/8948431/182504.htm
https://www.wur.nl/en/article/4.-How-many-animals-die-because-of-balloons.htm
https://www.peta.org/blog/balloon-releases-littering-and-killing-animals/
https://www.fws.gov/news/blog/index.cfm/2015/8/5/Balloons-and-Wildlife-Please-Dont-Release-Your-Balloons

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Post on Motorway message boards to remind middle lane 'Hoggers' to Pull Over
attributes.background:
Every driver has experienced being in a long tail back as one lorry slowly edges past another. 

Drivers can now be given 3 points for not pulling back into the Left-hand lane but this is not enforced. 

Why not use the Electronic signs to remind drivers to use the left to improve traffic flow?

attributes.action: Reverse UK Sport decision not to fund badminton
attributes.background: UK Sport withdrew funding from Badminton for the next Olympics and restored approximately 10% of this funding back. In contrast around 30 million of funding was given to athletes for winter sports. We petition the government to restore funding to Badminton for the next Olympics.
attributes.additional_details: Badminton is the most popular indoor sports in the UK and is one of the few sports that can be played all year round in the UK. Winter sports is not a common sports in UK as the weather conditions and facilities are not conducive to it. It is limited in its availability to masses. If proper funding is available, badminton is much more likely to yield Olympics medals and also motivate the younger generation to participate in a sport that is readily available to them.

attributes.action: New drivers to have black box with continuous speeding reported to the police
attributes.background: Most new drivers today think they are invincible on the roads. All black boxes do at the moment is record excessive speeding to the car insurance companies that use them. Why are these behaviours not reported to the police and why are drivers not punished for this behaviour?
attributes.additional_details: It should be mandatory that all new drivers have a black box for their first year of driving, with all continuous excessive speeding data sent to the police. Police should deal with this behaviour the same as if they caught the driver themselves, via a driving awareness course or points. Black boxes shouldn’t be limited to just cars either, they should be on all road legal transportation. This could not only potentially save lives, but save money on insurance in the long run too.

attributes.action: Change the Numeracy and Literacy Skills Tests to unlimited attempts
attributes.background: All trainee teachers have to sit numeracy and literacy skills tests in order to achieve Qualified Teacher Status. This should be changed from 3 attempts to unlimited attempts. Currently after 3 failed attempts the candidate cannot take these tests again for another 2 years.
attributes.additional_details: Each question from the mathematics section is timed putting a huge amount of pressure on trainee teachers. The maths and literacy skills tests should be revised and adapted depending on the age of the children the candidate wants to work with. For example primary and secondary trainee teachers should sit different tests, with the secondary teaching test being harder as the level of teaching required would be more challenging due to GCSE's.

attributes.action: Move the Palace of Westminster to new purpose-built Parliament in Birmingham
attributes.background: The existing Palace of Westminster is no longer 'fit for purpose'.  The adversarial debating chamber is archaic and the infrastructure needs total upgrading.  The proposed cost for refurbishment could be spent on a new building in Birmingham, the centre of Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
It's time Parliament dragged itself into the 21st century.  By relocating to Birmingham in the centre of Britain, government can truly represent all the people and not just the elite, privileged few.  
Estimated costs to refurbish the existing Palace of Westminster are unacceptable:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jan/28/mps-to-vote-on-vacating-parliament-building-in-need-of-refurbishment
A modern debating chamber is essential for fair government.

attributes.action: Recognise "Mx" as an official title for non binary and other gender identities
attributes.background:
Mx (pronounced mix) is a term used by people who don't fit the stereotypical gender boundaries. 
Mx has been added by Tesco as a title in which a customer can address themselves. We ask for it to be legal in other documents such as passports, driving licenses, for queer couples getting married.
attributes.additional_details: Tesco have listed it as an option for their customers. - reference https://secure.tesco.com/account/en-GB/register

attributes.action: Establish a Public Service Production Company thats funded by the British public
attributes.background: Our film industry is currently a subsidiary of the US film industry. US Film Companies are incentivised by the Government to produce their films in the UK through tax rebates and breaks Instead of financially supporting the US industry the Government needs to financially support it's own
attributes.additional_details:
The petitions asks for the establishment of a publicly owned and funded film production company that produces films which serve a public interest. 

References http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-28213379 http://ask.ofcom.org.uk/help/television/what_is_psb http://www.newstatesman.com/culture/2015/03/we-dont-have-british-film-industry-business-film-takes-us-behind-movie-scenes

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time - and they don't consider Volunteering and Work Placement experience as valuable: only formal, paid employment experience within the previous 6 months will suffice. 

This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods, claiming benefits for far longer than they want to, and open to harassment from Job Centre staff and the media.

attributes.action: Remove the Home Office exemption from the Data Protection Act
attributes.background: The Home Office has been given an exemption from GDPR and the data protection Act 2018. Citizens have a right to know what is being discussed with regard to their cases and an exemption puts us at risk of more scandals such as windrush.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should not be denied the right to their data and further exclusions from society.

attributes.action: Help stop the growing violence and murders of Christians in Nigeria
attributes.background: It is estimated that over 16,000 Christians have been killed in Nigeria since 2015. No group has been brought to justice and the scale of these atrocities keeps rising. We need the UK Government to add pressure on the Nigerian govt. to put a stop to these killings before it escalates to war.
attributes.additional_details:
These are links from local news papers and social media 
https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/06/will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/
https://www.persecution.org/2018/02/13/report-claims-16000-christians-killed-nigeria-since-2015/
https://www.spectator.co.uk/2017/02/who-will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/

attributes.action: Ban all non-biodegradable plastic used within the fashion industry
attributes.background: There are estimated 12.7 million tonnes of plastic ends up in the ocean every year. This waste releases toxins, absorbed by animals, subsequently entering the food chain. A ban on non-biodegradable plastic from the fashion industry could limit the micro-plastics that end up in the ocean.
attributes.additional_details:
- Greenpeace (2018). Ocean Plastic. Available at: https://www.greenpeace.org.uk/what-we-do/oceans/plastics/ (Accessed: 30 April 2018).
- Kozlowski, A., Bardecki, M. & Searcy, C., 2012. Environmental Impacts in the Fashion Industry: A Life-cycle and Stakeholder Framework. The Journal of Corporate Citizenship, (45), pp.17–36.
- Seltenrich, N., 2015. New link in the food chain? Marine plastic pollution and seafood safety. Environmental health perspectives, 123(2), pp.A34–41.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting age to 16
attributes.background:
At 16, UK citizens can do the following:
Get married with consent
Can own property
Can get a job
Can join the army
Pay taxes
Join a trade union
Many 16 year-olds feel that as they contribute to society and the country, they deserve their voices heard as to its political direction and leader.

attributes.action: UK public to vote on any military action
attributes.background: The UK government get involved in military action again and yet no member of the UK public voted or have any choice if they use our tax pounds to pay for it or indeed even to get involved. #notinmyname

attributes.action: The emergency SMS number 112 should be advertised on TV by the government.
attributes.background: The emergency SMS number 112 is a very useful alternative emergency services number to 999.  It is a number that also works across Europe and most countries worldwide. In training sessions for Basic Life Support it is clear that most people have never hear of its key properties.
attributes.additional_details: The properties of the emergency number 112 needs to be advertised by the UK government in a television information campaign on BBC. The advantages of 112 are that it is a GPS service.  People who are trying to contact emergency services do not need to know where they are as the 112 service can pin point their location.  Also, people can register their phone number to text an emergency message to 112.  This is crucial in areas where a phone signal is not possible.  The text will get through.

attributes.action: Make the judgement and discrimination of mental illness unlawful.
attributes.background: 'Neurophobia' describes the judgement and discrimination people show towards mental illness and those suffering with poor mental health. It is only illegal to discriminate against someone if their mental illness affects them enough that it becomes a disability.
attributes.additional_details: It should be illegal to discriminate against people whether or not their illness is a disability. Neurophobia must be recognised as unlawful and unacceptable to allow our society to insist upon equality. Our campaign www.notoneurophobia.com is to raise awareness of Neurophobia. Our aim is to recognise Neurophobia in the same way we recognise racism, homophobia and sexism so that the judgement and discrimination many people with poor mental health face can be eradicated from society.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to pay into the 'Teachers' Pension'.
attributes.background: Supply teachers cannot pay into the Teachers' Pension. If you are contracted for 2 hours a week you can opt-in, but as a supply teacher working 5 days a week you can't. Why? Because supply agencies don't employ us, so can't pay the employer's contribution. The ethics of agencies are another debate.
attributes.additional_details: Supply teachers used to be employed by LEAs. They were paid to scale, had pay progression and a pension. Successive governments have turned a blind eye to agencies taking this role where supply teachers are not paid to scale, have no pay progression and have no pension. A supply teacher will earn £16000 a year if they work every school day (the agencies having got £29,250 for that teacher). Some things we have to accept: the government signing our pension away, we shouldn't have to.

attributes.action: Govt take action to protect UK citizens in Kerala regarding elephant parades
attributes.background: Every year UK citizens visit Kerala to watch religious ceremonies exploiting captive elephants. The elephants are subjected to the most horrific cruelties in order to control them. The ceremonies always take place during musth season so the elephants are regularly running amock and harming people.
attributes.additional_details: It's important the Govt informs UK citizens of high risk of danger to human lives.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to impregnate dairy cows sooner than 2 years after giving birth
attributes.background: Dairy cattle are typically artificially inseminated every year to keep them pregnant or lactating. This, poor diet, selective breeding for milk yield, and preventing them moving, contribute to diseases and them being killed at usually 2 to 5 years old. Cows' natural lifespan is around 20 years.
attributes.additional_details: Scientific studies & other information https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/ https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16958626 https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2851724/

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring cattle allowed to graze grass outside min. 8 hours per day
attributes.background: Many dairy cattle are kept in sheds for up to 24 hours a day, in some cases all year. They're fed diets which aren't healthy or natural for them. As a result of this, over-milking and preventing movement they typically become ill and are killed at 3 to 5 years old. Their natural lifespan is 20 years
attributes.additional_details:
Scientific studies & other information
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17033013
https://stud.epsilon.slu.se/5285/1/kivling_s_130215.pdf
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
http://www.research.ed.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/housing-system-milk-production-and-zerograzing-effects-on-lameness-and-leg-injury-in-dairy-cows(117d66b0-cd77-4c79-82f6-d15053cd02fb).html

attributes.action: Lower Prescription charges
attributes.background: People already pay taxes which goes to medicine which technically means that everyone is paying twice. This means we pay to make or buy them from other places, then we pay again to get them from a pharmacy which is ridiculous.
attributes.additional_details: Some people get prescription that doesn’t work, but they still have to pay for a new prescription. This is not fair as you cannot get a refund and the prescription did not do what it was made to do.

attributes.action: Abolish workplace parking charges for NHS staff
attributes.background: These people dedicate their lives to helping the sick and vulnerable and are often poorly paid . It seems extremely unfair that they should be charged for attending work.

attributes.action: Assault on emergency service workers   must  carry a term of imprisonment!
attributes.background: Assaults on emergency service workers, i.e. police, fire personnel, paramedic and nurses are too frequently dealt with by caution or suspended sentences. Suspects must be prosecuted and. if convicted, receive an immediate custodial sentence of at least 6 months.

attributes.action: Debate the relevance of the Right to Buy legislation
attributes.background: Because of the increasing number of homeless families/single people, this request asks that Parliament debates the relevancy of the Right to Buy legislation, considering whether by revoking it thereby leaving more homes under Council control the numbers of homeless might decrease.
attributes.additional_details: I recently saw a discussion on the television where the particular Council responding to a question concerning their inability to house homeless families/single people said that for every three properties they built, two others of their stock went for 'right to buy'. I know little of the problems of Councils housing people nor of the Right to Buy Legislation but it seems to me possible that those that introduced the legislation may not have anticipated todays number of homeless.

attributes.action: Scrap school league tables to reduce pressures on young people and teachers
attributes.background: At the root cause of mental health difficulties in young people are league tables. There is pressure on students and staff to succeed as they are judged on exam performance data. Students with special educational needs flounder or move from mainstream schools which are struggling to be inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
The government recognises the need to transform the mental health provision for children and young people (Green paper, Dec 2017). Whilst the proposals are welcomed, it would make sense to address the underlying causes. 
The Guardian stated that exclusions are increasing partly because schools are under pressure to compete in league tables and exam results. Disruptive,vulnerable pupils who are likely to lower overall GCSE performance are weeded out before their national tests (Oct 2017).

attributes.action: Introduce laws to stop the sale of knives from easily viewable display cases.
attributes.background: With the increase of knife attacks across the UK. We are asking for tighter laws controlling the sale of knives from display cases. Knifes should be sold from covered cabinets. You can't buy cigarettes from open displays due to the impact on health. We should treat the sale of knives the same way.
attributes.additional_details: Open and easily viewable cases that display knives are showing them as glamour items. They show knives and advertise them as exciting accessible items. Take a store in Sheffield that is displaying knives like the USMC Ka-bar. This is clearly a military knife. If knives are not on display and are not easily viewed, accessible or advertised in a glamorous ways. People that use them genuine reasons will have to ask for them. This allows for retailers to question their legitimate use and purpose.

attributes.action: Ban Gambling Adverts Pre-Watershed
attributes.background:
This petition aims to get the government to introduce legislation to ban gambling adverts from being shown pre-watershed. 

Gambling is a huge problem in the UK, last year a Gambling Commission report finds more than 2 million people are addicted to gambling or at risk of developing a problem [1].
attributes.additional_details: [1] https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/aug/24/problem-gamblers-uk-gambling-commission-report

attributes.action: Open a coroner's inquest for every stillborn baby.
attributes.background: In 2011 a midwife signed by baby off to receive a stillborn certificate. 7 years I have fought and in March this year the coroner found that my baby was NOT stillborn. He survived for 1hr10minutes, he suffered a neonatal death and should have received a Birth and Death certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
How many more families have/are going through this? How many babies could there be that have been wrongfully categorised as Stillborn?
We need to change the law so that every single baby who the midwives/doctors believe to be stillborn receives a coroner's inquest. If this was the case back in 2011 it would have saved our family 7 years of heartache. 
Now our son's birth will be registered and he will forever be on our family tree, he will never be forgotten, what every baby deserves.

attributes.action: The immediate expulsion of all Israeli diplomats and sanctions against Israel.
attributes.background: The atrocities taking place in Gaza needs to be brought to the attention of the government. Israel needs to be held accountable for its actions against innocent people.

attributes.action: Reduce knife and gun crime with deterrent sentences
attributes.background:
10 yrs minimum for carrying a knife 
20 yrs minimum for using a knife 

20yrs minimum for carrying a gun
40yrs minimum for using a gun

All without parole.
attributes.additional_details:
The current sentences that the judiciary are handing out are obviously not deterrent enough

Act now !

Save lives !

attributes.action: Clearing pavements of ice should not bring legal liability if someone then falls
attributes.background: The law is such that persons clearing public pavements of snow and ice, e.g. outside their house or business, are then liable for civil action in the event someone slips, whereas not clearing the ice means you are not responsible, and thus can't be sued. The result is more dangerous pavements.
attributes.additional_details:
While the principle of "liability where actions have been taken" is sound, in this case it results in a less beneficial outcome. 
Government advice is "you're unlikely to be sued", but that is hardly encouraging. https://www.gov.uk/clear-snow-road-path-cycleway

There will always be a grey area where the use of inappropriate methods (like warm water) should be admissible when determining blame, but in the absence of such proof, the intent to clear ice in itself should not bring liability.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ask for someone’s previous salary.
attributes.background:
The salary negotiation process, and specifically the gender salary gap is directly affected by a company knowing a person’s previous salary. 

The salary band for the role should be defined for the role, and based on the responsibility and scope.

This shouldn’t be based on the previous salary.
attributes.additional_details: Previous salary should be treated like date of birth or age, gender, disability or trade union membership.

attributes.action: Investigate the links between MPs and foreign intelligence services
attributes.background: In our age of democracy it is important that all our representatives in Parliament do not act in a way that can be seen to be against parliamentary and democratic standards.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all cyclists to wear reflective jackets in the dark.
attributes.background: I frequently drive in the dark during the Autumn/Winter months and have noticed how frequently I pass cyclists that are not wearing anything reflective. To ensure the safety of cyclists and of drivers, I feel that it should be compulsory for them to wear a reflective jacket in the dark.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the cyclists I pass in the Autumn/Winter months wear dark clothing and rely on a small bicycle light to make them noticeable to drivers. It is not safe and it is not helpful. I feel that these cyclists are putting their own lives at risk by not wearing reflective clothing and by not doing so, also putting drivers at risk. I feel quite strongly about this, mostly because the reflective jackets are not expensive, so there is no excuse not to wear one.

attributes.action: To be made law that all public buildings in the UK to fly the Union Flag
attributes.background: Many countries around the world take pride in their national flag it seems the that UK is almost afraid to fly its flag for the fear of upsetting someone. After BREXIT we will once again be an independent country and should fly our flag as often and conspicuously as possible on all public buildings

attributes.action: Provide increase support for parents with disabilities and their children
attributes.background: Children who have parents with disabilities are only able to access free school meals, the nursery grant for 2 year olds and pupil premium if they are on income related benefits. This means many working parents with a disabled partner are left better off leaving work to care for their families.
attributes.additional_details: Where a parent is on PIP they are considered “incapacitated” for childcare purposes in tax credit legislation and for extended hours nursery provision for 3 year olds. This does not extend to pupil premium, 2 year old nursery places or to free school meals - even if the incapacitated parent is unable to prepare a meal for themselves. Where one parent works and the other is considered incapacitated, children should receive these in order for the working parent to remain in work.

attributes.action: Cut National Citizens Service funding and apply funds to schools and the NHS
attributes.background: In 2017 NCS recieved £180.5 million from the government and has proceeded to spend it on extravagant advertisements instead of the actual service. This money could be better used by schools which constantly face budget cuts and the NHS which is in desperate need of more funding.

attributes.action: Raise the definition of a child in the Mental Health Act to from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Parents of 16 year old children held under the Mental Health Act cannot find out how they’re coping. The staff are unable to share any information on the children. Children under 18 are unable to keep themselves safe, so 16 to 18 year olds should be classified as children under the Act.

attributes.action: Allow RSPCA to seize animals that they believe to be in danger
attributes.background:
The police have to be there for the RSPCA to seize an animal, because of this it is a lot of time wasted for the Police force. 

RSPCA are educated on these situations and should be allowed to go ahead and take any animal they believe to be in danger without the authorities.
attributes.additional_details: Not being able to take an animal that is in danger can cause harm to the animal and sometimes this becomes fatal and there will be a court case, which also is a lot of wasted money when it could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pencil sharpeners with easy release blades.
attributes.background: Many young adults these days with the pressures of school, friends and social media struggle at times and sadly turn to self-harm. As a parent you can hide all the sharp cutting items in your house only to find your child using the removable blade from a pencil sharpener.
attributes.additional_details: How is that an under 18 can’t go and buy a knife, razor or anything with a blade but can go and buy a pencil sharpener which has a removable blade? There’s even a video on YouTube that shows you how to remove it although it is only a tiny screw holding it in so it’s not rocket science! To ban all under 18s buying one is not perceivable but I do believe they could be manufactured differently such as having a non-tamper screw. If the Government bans those where the blade is easy to release, industry will follow with a safer product. Something has to be done.

attributes.action: Insist the Government give a 50% discount for Council Tax single occupants
attributes.background: At the moment single occupants get a 25% reduction in their Council Tax which is most unfair. In houses with more than one person there are more like to be dual or more incomes, so there the reduction should be 50% to single occupant earners or pensioners as they are pay 25% more on one income.

attributes.action: Launch a National Consultation on Reducing Plastic Usage
attributes.background: Blue Planet 2 has started a national talk on reducing plastic usage, we need to start reducing the hidden plastics in retailers, e.g. Plastic cutlery, wrapping around magazines, DVDs, CDs, Cigarettes etc. A national consultation is needed with companies to reduce the usage of plastics.

attributes.action: Legislate to give wheelchair users priority access to bus wheelchair spaces
attributes.background:
Wheelchair users do not have lawful priority over other passengers for access to designated wheelchair spaces/bays on public buses.

There have been frequent and media reported cases of such persons being able to travel as other passengers refused to move. Legislation is required to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike passenger railway systems, persons in wheelchairs do not have priority access to wheelchair spaces provided on buses, despite this being the only safe space for a person in a wheelchair to travel.

Despite the recent Supreme Court case brought by Doug Paulley, bus drivers have no legal power to force other passengers to move, and can still only request that they do so.

This is detrimental to any person in a wheelchair and has a significant impact on travel.

attributes.action: Toughen UK knife laws, raise the age to buy knives over 3 inches to 21 years old
attributes.background: Knife crime is an epidemic in the UK, surely raising the age to buy knives would shrink the culture our country has normalised. It would mean teenagers can no longer buy knives to use as weapons. Knife crime was 6x more likely to occur in 2017 than gun crime. I wonder why?
attributes.additional_details: London has a huge issue with knife and gang related crime, minimising the amount of people able to buy knives must surely impact this. Nearly 13000 recorded incidents of knife crime in Just London last year, with less knives on the street in the wrong hands surely this statistic would also plummet.

attributes.action: The immigration amnesty of Grenfell survivors should be indefinitely extended
attributes.background: ‘Foreign’ survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire were granted a temporary 12-month immigration “amnesty” for them to stay in the U.K. regardless of their immigration status but may still face deportation after that.

attributes.action: No to automatic opt in for organ donation
attributes.background: UK resident will be automatically opted in for organ donation and will have the choice to opt out after the Bill is passed.  This law should not be passed because it is our body and it is our human right to opt in ourselves if we want to.
attributes.additional_details: Our body is not the property of the government to give this consent on our behalf. It is a  violation of our human rights. People are aware of organ donation and can choose to opt in if they wish to opt in. People may not be able to opt out before their death as death can be sudden. People may not be aware of this law so it will be unethical to opt them in as they wouldn't know they have to opt out. We refuse this law should be passed where peoole are automatically registered to organ donation.

attributes.action: Reduce the deadline date of the tampon tax from 2022 to 2019!
attributes.background: The Treasury vowed to axe the outdated tax on all sanitary products in January 2016. Currently, the Tampon Tax is set to be abolished by 2022 at the earliest. Help to put an end to the marginalisation of issues of women by demanding a zero tax rate for sanitary products.
attributes.additional_details:
Women are expected to spend £900 in tax for their periods in their lifetime. Menstruation should not be labelled as a luxury.

Together, with the abolishment of the tampon tax, we can get rid of the taboo around menstruation.
